subject: Want to Work on A GAME OF THRONES?
event:
I get emails all the time from fans who want to be part of the filming.  

Well, now's your chance.

It would help if you live in Northern Ireland.  Or at least the UK or the Republic of Ireland.  Some actual experience in film or television production would be good as well.  I'm sorry, it really doesn't matter how much you love my books if you live in South Dakota and have no experience.

Anyway, here's the skinny:

http://northernirelandscreen.co.uk/page.asp?id=239

If you want to apply, please note the instructions therein and follow them precisely.  DO NOT SEND EMAILS OR RESUMES TO ME!  I will not be hiring anyone.  Nor am I willing to write recommendations for people I have never met, no matter how sincere or enthusiastic you may be.

If this is something you really want, though, hey, take a shot.  Can't hurt.  Who knows, perhaps the stars will align, and YOU will end up being Floor Runner #2.

(No, I don't know what Floor Runner #2 does either.  Possibly that's British for what we called "gopher" when I was in Hollywood.  Something to do with running about the floor, at a guess).

comments.article: Oh, George!

If this weren't a behind-the-cameras industry job, the studio could probably get away with auctioning it. The Wire, as I understand it, auctioned an appearance with at least one line of dialog for their Season 3 finale - the proceeds of which went to a charity I can't remember. (The winner played a crime scene investigator, who took photos of a major actor on the floor.)

Anyway, I hope your European fans jump on this. What a fun opportunity.

comments.upictitle: Fear and Loathing in South Down: Dr Gonzo
comments.article: I tried this with the pilot, they never got back to me...Floor Runners are go-for jobs.

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: I love being a grip so thank you muchly for posting this.
Wish I lived in ireland :(

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article: Though I like being a script supervisor even more!  I'm off to make my resume snazzier.  Thank you!

...... soooo you're saying if I meet you, I can then get a recommendation from you and before you know it I'll be able to play Jojen Reed. I have no previous acting experience, but man do I have some enthusiasm for the books, oh and don't forget my grit and moxy!!


Seriously this is where I do feel bad for you Mr. Martin. Those are the types of emails that would just crush my mood

Wow. Sure looks awesome. Once upon a time - like ten years ago - this might have sent me into a frenzy...now that I'm a somewhat settled employee of Bayer here in Germany, I just would be interested in: Where in Northern Ireland would I have to spend my summer vacation to get a glimpse of the action??? I'd hold umbrellas and pass out sunscreen as well, but, realistically speaking, since I've been a floor-runner and a grip in my life and won't be aiming for anything "productive" - where can I be just a non-interference fangirl and tourist? Of course, if that information's classified...just as well. Éireann go Brách - I hope there's going to be more than one season!

Today, a girl named Laura Gonzalo has won a famous TC contest, "Pasapalabra" (something like "Next word"), wearing a tee of the House Stark. This is a guess the word contest.
Here's the video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=awNtdF8tVHA
The prize was 282.000€!!!!
comments.subject: A girl wins 282.000€ in a famous spanish TV contest wearing a STARK tee

comments.article:
And remember that when they say "09/04", that means 9 April, not September 4. So don't keep waiting to hear back from them.

And yep, they need experience. These are going to be pretty boring jobs for anyone who doesn't love the work, and not just the books the movie is based on.
I know it's a long shot, but do you by any chance know where to send in information about being an extra?

Extras NI is the extras agency providing such services to the production. :) It looks like they're not accepting any more applications to be registered with them right now, but contacting them wouldn't hurt.
"Production Buyer" that sounds like a nice job.
"running about the floor" lol

Really would loved to have played Hodor, but they never took my offer seriously. (sniff)

So it's back to Wildland Fire & Archaeology for me. If you ever need a 7'1" 310 lb. ex commando with a 147 IQ look for me here.

http://xenophon.page.tl/
comments.subject: Don't call us, we'll call you...

comments.article: So tempted to apply as the Accounts Clerk. Not a hope of getting it though.
I have lots of experience running on floors. I do it all the time!!! No experience running on walls or ceilings...but lots of it running on floors.
comments.subject: Floor runner!!!

comments.article: Any chance you know if they'll be shooting scenes on these fair American continents anytime?  I hear British Columbia is lovely to work in.

comments.upictitle: Stop drooling at my pic!!!!: Author pose
comments.article:
Right location, wrong job

If only you wrote in an Electron Microscopist, then I would have definitely got it.

Haha, I was just thinking "damn, if only they needed a German/French/English translator, I'd be all over that..."

I suppose having worked at Starbucks I could make the morning coffee? ;P I do hope they get a couple of fans in there, it'd be a fun experience.
South Dakota is a fine state.  I should know, it hangs out right next door.  Wonderful fishing.  Wait, what were we talking about?

*sends an email to every production, prop and costume designer she knows*
Dublin, represent :)

What exactly does a script supervisor do? I picture a guy/gal sitting in a chair closely watching a stack of stapled together pages. Hmm! I could do that!

Okay, so I don't live in Ireland, but my great grandmother was Irish. Does that count?

It would be great to be a part of all that. Love the books and can picture the finished version on my widescreen. I hope whoever they get to complete the cast and crew does Ice & Fire justice.
comments.subject: Script Supervisor?

comments.article:
**I'm sorry, it really doesn't matter how much you love my books if you live in South Dakota and have no experience.**

Well, hellz.

If I even just partially fit any of the criteria needed to work on the set, I'd be off to Northern Ireland before you could say "Shillelagh"! But alas, I'm stuck here.

One position they really need to fill, though, is Teaser Trailer Editor... the trailer they have out now is a bit... illegally derivative. ;)

Does anybody know the agency in charge for the acting cast?
Maybe it's too late for the first season, but one never knows...
Thanks!
comments.subject: And what about acting?
